name: Living Wick
conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, unconscious
senses: sight 20 ft. (blind beyond the radius of its own light)
languages: shares a telepathic link with the individual that lit its wick

trait.name: Controlled
text: Living wicks cannot move, attack, or perform actions when they are not lit. Living wicks only respond to the telepathic commands of the individual that lit them.

trait.name: Light
text: Activated living wicks produce light as a torch.

trait.name: Melting
text: A living wick loses one hit point for every 24 hours it remains lit.

action.name: Slam
text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Consume Self
text: A living wick can be commanded to rapidly burn through the remains of its wick, creating a devastating fireball. All creatures within 20 feet of the living wick take 7 (2d6) fire damage, or half damage with a successful DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. The fire spreads around corners and ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried. The wick is reduced to a lifeless puddle of wax.
